describe: China, officially the People's Republic of China, is a vast country in East Asia with a rich history, diverse culture, and rapidly growing economy. It is known for its ancient civilization, technological advancements, and significant global influence.

cities.name: üèô Beijing
cities.geographical_location: Located in northern China, Beijing is the capital city.
cities.climate: Beijing has a monsoon-influenced humid continental climate with hot, humid summers and cold, dry winters.
cities.famous_cuisine: Peking Duck, Jiaozi (dumplings), Zhajiangmian (noodles with soybean paste)

cities.name: üèù Shanghai
cities.geographical_location: Situated on the eastern coast of China, Shanghai is a major financial hub.
cities.climate: Shanghai experiences a humid subtropical climate with four distinct seasons.
cities.famous_cuisine: Xiaolongbao (soup dumplings), Shengjian Mantou (pan-fried buns), Hairy Crab

cities.name: üèù Guangzhou
cities.geographical_location: Located in southern China, Guangzhou is the capital of Guangdong province.
cities.climate: Guangzhou has a humid subtropical climate with long, hot summers and mild, dry winters.
cities.famous_cuisine: Dim Sum, Char Siu (barbecued pork), Wonton Noodles

cities.name: üèô Xi'an
cities.geographical_location: Situated in central China, Xi'an is the capital of Shaanxi province.
cities.climate: Xi'an has a temperate climate with hot summers and cold, dry winters.
cities.famous_cuisine: Biang Biang Noodles, Roujiamo (Chinese hamburger), Yangrou Paomo (lamb soup with bread)

cities.name: üèù Sanya
cities.geographical_location: Located on the southern tip of Hainan Island, Sanya is known for its beaches.
cities.climate: Sanya has a tropical wet and dry climate with warm temperatures year-round.
cities.famous_cuisine: Hainanese Chicken Rice, Wenchang Chicken, Dongshan Lamb
